content.title: Marriage Assistance (ANBOCWWB)
content.beneficiary: Registered construction workers and their dependent children
content.details: The scheme 'Marriage Assistance' was started by the Andaman & Nicobar Islands Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (ANBOCWWB). Under this scheme, registered construction workers will receive a financial allowance to cover either their own marriage expenses or those of their two dependent children.
benefits: Financial assistance of ₹20,000/- to cover either their own marriage expenses or those of their two dependent children.
eligibility: The beneficiary should be a resident of the Union territory of Andaman & Nicobar Islands.
The beneficiary should be engaged in any building & other construction work.
The beneficiary should be registered under the A&N Islands Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.
The beneficiary should have an active membership of the Board.
The assistance shall be given to meet the marriage expenses of the worker or his/her two dependent children.
exclusions: Marriage assistance is limited for two children only.
documents_required: 90 Days Work Duration Certificate issued by the competent authority
Identity proof of worker i.e. Aadhaar Card
Bank account details of worker/Copy of passbook
Identity proof of Son/Daughter for whose marriage assistance is sought

faqs.question: What is the objective of the 'Marriage Assistance' scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to registered construction workers or their dependent children to cover marriage expenses.

faqs.question: What are the benefits provided under the Scheme?
faqs.answer: Registered construction workers are eligible to receive financial assistance of ₹20,000/- to cover either their own marriage expenses or those of their two dependent children.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to benefit from this scheme?
faqs.answer: A registered worker under the A&N Islands Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board and having an active membership of the Board is eligible to apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: Is the assistance limited to covering only the worker's marriage expenses?
faqs.answer: No, the assistance can also be utilized to cover the marriage expenses of the worker's two dependent children.

faqs.question: Is there any limit on the number of children for whom assistance can be claimed?
faqs.answer: Yes, the assistance is limited to covering the marriage expenses of two dependent children of the worker.

faqs.question: Can the financial assistance be used for any other purpose besides marriage expenses?
faqs.answer: No, the assistance is specifically designated for meeting marriage expenses and cannot be used for any other purpose.

faqs.question: Are there any documents required for applying for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Documentation requirements such as proof of residency, employment in construction work, registration with the welfare board, and details regarding the marriage event or dependent children may be necessary.

faqs.question: How to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The eligible applicant may apply online through Portal: https://serviceonline.gov.in/login.do
